page.title: 12Ecology, Yelden
page.content: The low rolling landscape consists of chalky boulder clay overlying Oxford clay. Rainfall is low (450-575mm) The winters are not severe but spring is late and cold because of the heavy clays, however sunshine is above the national average. There are many different types of wild flowers, and birds and butterflies abound and in the clean air, lichens grow on buildings and trees. Many trees have been plnted since 1973, replacing elms lost by disease. Those planted in the village centre commemorate the Silver Jubilee. Cambridge Conservation Corps have camped in the village hall and cleared woodland. Community Service Volunteers have cleared the banks of the River Till through the village to stop flooding.
